intro: Calyptrocalyx polyphyllus, commonly known as the many-leaved calyptrocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its numerous, narrow leaves arranged in whorls around the stem. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
